A music teacher in The Woodlands has been accused of sexually assaulting a child under 14, and police are looking for more possible victims. 
Bernardo Placencia, 22, gave private lessons for two years at the School of Rock at 30420 FM 2978 in the suburb north of Houston. 
The school said they immediately contacted law enforcement on Nov. 3 when a parent informed them of inappropriate touching. 
The Montgomery County Precinct 3 Constable's Office received a complaint alleging that Placencia committed aggravated sexual assault of a child on Nov. 3. Detectives found probable cause and arrested him Thursday at his home in Harris County. 
In a statement, the School of Rock said it requires prospective instructors to undergo a criminal background check, but records suggest Placencia did not have a criminal history. The school said it also has safety training for instructors and designed its buildings "to facilitate visibility into lesson rooms." Placencia is no longer employed there. 
Public records suggest Placencia lives with his parents at their Tomball home. He does not have a defense lawyer listed. His family declined comment. 
Police believe there may be more victims among the children who got music lessons from Placencia. Anyone wishing to come forward with information is asked to contact Detective Adam Acosta at 936-538-3414. Subscribe to HCN
